results.title: Microchips rule OK
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of work”.
A short and impressionistic film which poses the question are computers a good or bad thing for the workforce? Includes interviews with unemployed youth, workers and archival footage of the introduction of computers into the workplace. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

group_siblings.title: TV news: behind the scenes
group_siblings.creator_credit: Randolph Hobler, Michael Livesey, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: TV news: behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Randolph Hobler, Michael Livesey, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of work”.
Follows one day’s preparation of an evening TV news broadcast at a major New York studio, showing how stories are assigned and reported, with examples of on the spot coverage. Concentrates on the editorial and technical teamwork involved in the selection and final preparation of news stories to be presented on air, with special emphasis on the contributions of key members of the newsroom staff. Narrated by John Barnes.

results.title: The World of Peter Rabbit and friends
results.creator_credit: John Coates, Frederick Warne and Company and TVC London
results.brief_description: The delightful drawings and stories of Beatrix Potter are stunningly recreated in this excellent series. From the mischievious Peter Rabbit and his near fatal encounter with Mr. McGregor, to Jemima Puddle-duck and her naive trust in the Fox, these stories will entertain and stimulate young minds.

results.title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit and Benjamin Bunny
results.creator_credit: Dennis Abey, Geoff Dunbar, Ginger Gibbons and Grand Slamm Partnership
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of Peter Rabbit and friends”.
Beatrix Potter’s beautifully illustrated books have long been a favourite with children. Her stories of the mischievous cousins, Peter Rabbit and Benjamin Bunny, come to life on the screen in this delightful animated adaptation. The video includes a live-action introduction dramatising Beatrix Potter and the animals that inspired her books.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David the gnome enters the wonderful world of adventure as he tries to help his fellow creatures out of trouble. This program consists of 2 episodes, ‘Good Medicine’ captures David’s skills as a doctor and ‘Witch Way Out?’ finds David and his faithful fox, Swift, captured by ugly and vicious trolls. Based on the book “The Gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Will Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, Miramax Films and Cinar Films

results.title: Little houses for little people
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David tells us more about the magical world of the gnomes. In “Little houses for little people” he explains the gnomes’ secret and special underground houses. “The wedding that almost wasn’t” - All the Gnomes gather to celebrate a wedding - but the trolls are unwelcome guests! Based on “The gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
Join David, his wife Lisa and faithful fox, Swift, for two wonderful adventures in the secret and magical world of the gnomes. “Good medicine” tells how David’s skill as a doctor is needed to help a sick animal. In ‘Witch way out” David and Swift are captured by the ugly and vicious trolls. Based on “The gnomes’ by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films

results.title: The World at war. - Volume 6.
results.creator_credit: Martin Smith, Ted Childs and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The World at war”.
Part 11: “Red Star” The story of Russia’s massive lonely war with its 20,000,000 military and civilian casualties. A Leningrad housewife who survived the 890 day siege from September 1941, until January 1944 appears in this program. She agrees she was lucky to survive. In her city of three million inhabitants 200,000 people were killed by German shells, a further 630,000 died of cold or starvation. Incredibly the Russians survived and went on to rout the Germans. Part 12: “Whirlwind” The blitz on Britain brings strident public demand for revenge bombing but by the end of 1941 Britain’s force of 700 aircraft is being eaten into by the demands of the North Africa and Atlantic battles. The arrival of Arthur “Bomber” Harris to take charge of Bomber Command heralds a new attitude. Harris is very much in favour of revenge - “They have sowed the wind and now shall reap the whirlwind”, he proclaims publicly. More important, he believes that bombing can, on its own, defeat Germany.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Smith, Ted Childs and Thames Television
